comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Woodrow Wilson was given the Freedom of the City of London on December 28, 1918. See http://query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9907E6D911... NYT of Dec 29, 1918 and www.woodrowwilsonhouse.org/timeline/ImageDisplay.asp?ID=182 for the ceremonial casket that was later given to hold the document presented in this ceremony.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Lord Mayor at the time was Sir Horace Brooks Marshall (1865–1936), Lord Mayor of London See www.bbc.co.uk/arts/yourpaintings/paintings/sir-horace-bro... for a portrait in the same robes. The ceremony was at the Guildhall. It looks from the paneling as though the picture is at the end of the Great Hall. www.guildhall.cityoflondon.gov.uk/great_hall.htm
